title: Assign a Value to a Text Variable
description: Now that you have declared variables to store a first and last name, add the two assignment blocks to the program in the correct location. Then replace the text values with a made up character's first and last name so they match the correct variable. Then run your program and check the output window for the character's first and last name.
hint:
Be sure to place the assignment blocks after the variables are declared and before the output blocks. Read the comments for a hint.

You may notice that if you placed the assignment blocks after the output blocks the first and last name won't be in the output window. This is because the variables are declared with an empty text value and when output is called the variables don't yet have a first or last name set. Programs run each block in order starting at the top of the program.
